events.name: Bitkipper Bremen - Get together and have a beer
events.description:
Hello Bremen und umzu,

we have an official Google Developers Group, now let's have our first meetup. Here we can get to know each other, gather feedback on what each of us would like this GDG to be about and drink some beer.

The date is set to see how many would be able to attend and a place will be announced later. It is important for this GDG to bring and organize events that developers alike are interested in, your participation will help shape the future of this group.

Cheers,

Rafael
GDG Bremen

events.name: Android Things Workshop
events.description:
Android is already in the pockets of many of us, in some TVs, computers and even cars, but what about your fridge? Learn how to develop an app for Android Things using an Android Things Developer Kit (ATDevKit).

You'll be able to get hands on experience connecting cables and writing code for your own Android Things project in just a couple of hours.

Cheers,
Your GDG Bremen team
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be located in the meeting room inside the car gallery.

events.name: Hack all the Things 2: Android Things Workshop
events.description:
The second instalment of our wonderful Android Things workshop, as spontaneous as ever.

Android is already in the pockets of many of us, in some TVs, computers and even cars, but what about your fridge? Learn how to develop an app for Android Things using an Android Things Developer Kit (ATDevKit).

• What we'll do
You'll be able to get hands on experience connecting cables and writing code for your own Android Things smart doorbell in just a couple of hours.

• What to bring
Bring a Laptop with Android Studio preinstalled.

• Important to know
Although knowing how to program for Android or Java helps, anyone is welcome to come as long as they're interested.
events.how_to_find_us: Go to the team neusta mobile HQ

events.name: Building UI Consistent Android Apps
events.description:
A talk about design will be held by Nicola Corti from Yelp, stay a bit longer afterwards to talk and have a good time with developers and designers alike.

The event will be held on the offices of hmmh multimediahaus AG, hmmh will also provide catering.

## Abstract:

Consistency is probably one of the best known design principles.
Consistent UIs are easy to use, easy to learn and frustration free.
Nonetheless, they are also extremely easy to break! Just a few
development iterations are enough to totally mess up your color
palette or your icon sets.

Consistency gets even trickier if you have to ensure it across
different Android apps. In such a scenario, defining style guides
becomes crucial. Assets, icons, colors, metrics, and components should
be easily accessible by developers/designers across your teams.
Furthermore, you must ensure that every style guide change will not
break your app.

Yelp ships its experience across Android, iOS and Web apps used by
millions of users. In this talk, you will get an insight into the
challenges we face on a daily basis ensuring our visual consistency,
and the solutions we adopted.

## About Nicola Corti:

Nicola Corti is Android Software Engineer since 2.2, Free and Open
Source lover since he remembers. Currently working as an Android
Engineer @ Yelp Inc, connecting millions of users with great local
businesses worldwide.
He usually calls himself a "community addicted", can't survive without
learning every day, sharing knowledge and having fun with other
developers. He also funded and he's currently managing the GDG chapter
in Pisa and the Kotlin User Group in Hamburg

In his free time, he also loves photography, hiking, and cake design.

https://twitter.com/cortinico
https://github.com/cortinico

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Bremen
events.description:
Get together to watch the Google I/O 18 stream with something to eat and drink while enjoying what Sundar Pichai has to say.

We will also have Google Home devices available for a hands-on with the platform and even a chance to play with them yourself, either just by trying something new or doing a guided codelab.

Schedule:
18:00 - 18:15 A lightning talk about the Google Assistant
18:15 - 19:00 Hands-on with Google Home devices and Google Assistant codelab
19:00 - 20:30 Keynote Livestream
20:20 - 21:45 Break with codelabs for the Google Assistant and Food
21:45 - 22:45 Developer Keynote Livestream
events.how_to_find_us: Inside the Schuppen 1 Car gallery there is the entrance to the room Hafenkante

events.name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH)
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts in emerging fields like AR/VR and Voice UI, discover all the different ways in which technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites accessible and friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community — let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ❤️

Join us in Munich on November 10–11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest
Call for papers (until September 15): http://papercall.io/dachfest18

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2019 Bremen
events.description:
Let's get together to watch the livestream of the 2019 Google I/O keynote!

We will start at 18:00 with some snacks and drinks in a relaxing after-work atmosphere and watch the keynote together live at 19:00. If there is interest, we can also watch the developer keynote later on.

Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 warmup with snacks and drinks
19:00 - 20:30 keynote live-stream
20:30 - 21:45 time for networking
21.45 - 23:00 developer keynote live-stream

The event is free of charge and everyone is welcome!
events.how_to_find_us: The location is at the main entrance of Team Neusta (entrance 24). You'll need to ring, we'll let you in. Go to the 1st floor, pass the reception and turn left. It's the last room on the right (room 0111).

events.name: Bitkipper Bremen
events.description:
Hallo once again!

The Google I/O might be over but there is probably enough material (!) to talk about. In a relaxed bar atmosphere we would like to get to know each other better and possibly welcome some new members.
We will have the chance to talk about the possibilities for future meetups and see what your preferences are.
Beside that you can expect a lot of discussion about Google’s recent announcements from the I/O event!

In case you already want to get in touch with other members or have any questions we would like to invite you to join our new Slack channel (thanks to Roman for that!).

To join the channel please contact [masked].

Cheers,
The GDG Bremen organisator team

events.name: KOTLIN/Everywhere Bremen
events.description:
Datum: Samstag, 26. Oktober
Ort: Schuppen 1, Konsul-Smidt-Straße 26, Bremen

AGENDA:

10:00 Willkommen & Organisatorisches
10:30 Kotlin 101 & Kotlin Native/Multiplatform Talk
11:30 Kotlin 101 & Multiplatform Codelabs

12:15 Mittagspause

13:00 Kotlin Coroutines Talk
14:00 Kotlin 102 & Coroutines Codelabs
15:00 Kotlin Channels & Flow Talk

15:45 Chillout

Die Codelabs werden aufgeteilt in einen Anfänger- und einen Fortgeschrittenen Track und werden jeweils die Inhalte der vorher stattgefundenen Talks aufgreifen.

________________________________

Zum ersten Mal organisiert die Google Developer Group Bremen eine Kotlin/Everywhere-Veranstaltung, um die Verwendung der Programmiersprache Kotlin in der mobilen Entwicklung zu fördern.
Lasst uns an diesem Samstag zusammenkommen, um Kotlin zu lernen und Vorträge von Entwicklern zu hören, die unter anderem über ihre Erfahrungen mit Technologien wie Jetpack Compose und Kotlin Native berichten.

Die Vorträge werden von offenen Codelabs begleitet, in denen experimentiert und zusammen gearbeitet werden kann.

Die Veranstaltung findet in den Räumlichkeiten des team neusta statt. Pizza und Getränke werden von neusta mobile solutions gesponsert.
events.how_to_find_us:
Es werden Schilder an den Eingängen von vom Schuppen 1 aufgehangen, die euch zu den Räumlichkeiten führen. 

Begebt euch zu den Eingängen der Car Gallery an der Konsul-Smidt-Straße 26.

events.name: Dark Mode in Web
events.description:
A talk about Dark Mode in web will be held by Thomas Steiner from Google, stay a bit longer afterwards to talk and have a good time with developers and designers alike.

The event will be held on the offices of neuland - Büro für Informatik, neuland will also provide catering.

## Abstract:
Dark Mode is already in use for a couple of years on different platforms but gained quite some attention with the newest iOS release of Apple.

Thomas Steiner, Developer Advocate for Web at Google, will focus the usage and best practices of Dark Mode in web. He will speak about the user research and background of dark mode, performance optimization and design best practices.

events.name: Flutter Interact: Viewing Party Bremen
events.description:
Date: Monday, 11th of December
Location: Konsul-Smidt-Straße 24, Neusta Mobile Solutions, Bremen

AGENDA:

- TO BE ANNOUNCED

________________________________

We will live-stream the event at the facilities of Neusta Mobile Solutions and provide room for discussion and a relaxed getting together afterwards.

Pizza and drinks will be provided by Neusta Mobile Solutions.
